name: Slow-Roasted Winter Vegetables
author: Janis
summary: This is a mixture my husband came up with using what we had on hand in the fall, and it became a favorite. The first effort for these slow-roasted vegetables was on the BBQ, but it works just as well in the oven. Tastes even better re-heated, and makes great addition to soups and pot pies.
ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, chopped into 1/2-inch cubes
2 medium sweet potatoes, chopped into 1/2-inch cubes
2 medium parsnips, chopped into 1/2-inch cubes, or more to taste
4 medium carrots, chopped into 1/2-inch cubes, or more to taste
8 medium (blank)s fresh mushrooms, quartered, or more to taste
1 bulb garlic, cloves sliced lengthwise in half
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place butternut squash, yams, sweet potatoes, parsnips, carrots, turnip, mushrooms, shallots, and garlic in a large bowl
Toss until evenly mixed, then add oil and toss until coated
Pour into large baking pans so that the vegetables are no more than 1 1/2 inches deep
Bake in the preheated oven, tossing and scraping the bottom every 30 minutes, until vegetables are very tender, at least 90 minutes; longer is better
